item.title: You are my sunshine
item.dc:creator: Alexandra Petri
item.description: Come back soon, my neighborhood sun.

item.title: Glide bombs are raining on Ukraine while the House dawdles
item.dc:creator: Editorial Board
item.description: House Speaker Mike Johnson (R-La.) and his Republican majority wrongly delayed aid to Ukraine for six months — now it is time for them to approve it.

item.title: Oregon walks away from a disastrous drug experiment
item.dc:creator: Michael Ramirez
item.description: Michael Ramirez on Oregon drug decriminalization.

item.title: Wildfire fighters are quitting. Can you blame them?
item.dc:creator: Drew Goins
item.description: Plus: The end of No Labels. The too-slow creep of EV charging stations. Polio.

item.title: Leaders of Jordan, France and Egypt: Cease fire now in Gaza
item.dc:creator: King Abdullah II, Emmanuel Macron, Abdel Fatah El-Sisi
item.description: The establishment of an independent, sovereign Palestinian state on the basis of the two-state solution is the only way to achieve true peace.

item.title: How to build back better in Baltimore, and across the nation
item.dc:creator: Letters to the Editor
item.description: Break our free shipping addiction. Change traffic patterns. Honor immigrants. And take pity on Baltimore’s historical Liberty ship.

item.title: Trump’s abortion position just made his 2024 reelection even harder
item.dc:creator: Eugene Robinson
item.description: If antiabortion crusaders thought he was genuinely on their side, they should have been paying closer attention.

item.title: Chat with David Ignatius about the war in Ukraine and foreign affairs
item.dc:creator: David Ignatius
item.description: David’s live chat with readers starts at 12 p.m. ET on Monday. Submit your questions now.

item.title: When will the Ukraine war end? I answered your questions.
item.dc:creator: David Ignatius
item.description: David’s live chat with readers starts at 12 p.m. ET on Monday. Read the transcript.

item.title: Jan. 6 convicts aren’t ‘hostages’: Judge decries gaslighting
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Rubin
item.description: D.C. District Judge Royce C. Lamberth lashes out at MAGA deniers.

item.title: Being ‘tough on crime’ isn’t an appeal to White voters
item.dc:creator: Alexi McCammond
item.description: New York Gov. Kathy Hochul is trying to change the narrative that Democrats don’t take public safety seriously.

item.title: What Anne Lamott learned about love from becoming a grandparent
item.dc:creator: Alyssa Rosenberg
item.description: In a new book, the memoirist reflects on the ties between parents, children and grandchildren.

item.title: Liberals must answer the right’s attacks on America’s colleges
item.dc:creator: Perry Bacon
item.description: Democratic Party officials and the broader left need to forcefully push back against the right’s war on higher education.

item.title: The economy is strong. Why are our national finances so weak?
item.dc:creator: Megan McArdle
item.description: If this is the best Americans can do to manage the federal debt in the best of times, then when things get bad, the future will be much worse.

item.title: We built 7 EV chargers in 2 years. That’s actually not the problem.
item.dc:creator: Matt Bai
item.description: The charger program makes a ton of sense. The problem lies in the way the Democrats habitually mislead the public on the near-term impact of public investment.

item.title: One woman’s story of agony shows why childhood immunizations are so crucial
item.dc:creator: Leana Wen
item.description: Ina Pinkney explains why childhood immunizations are so crucial.

item.title: I was a wildfire fighter for six years. The reason they’re quitting is simple.
item.dc:creator: Christopher Benz
item.description: The government hasn’t raised pay in decades, and the Forest Service is losing experience.

item.title: In the shadow war with Iran, Biden just scored an unheralded victory
item.dc:creator: Max Boot
item.description: The U.S. military forcefully responded after its outposts in Iran and Syria were attacked. Now, the mullahs in Tehran have backed off.

item.title: The Caps and Wizards are staying in D.C. Here’s what should happen next.
item.dc:creator: Letters to the Editor
item.description: Field winning teams. Reduce the volume. Remember that Alexandria has other development options. And listen to what citizens want.

item.title: Farm girls have been scorching the nets on the prairies for some time now
item.dc:creator: Art Cullen
item.description: The rest of the country has finally caught up to Midwesterners’ passion for women’s sports.

item.title: Ahead of state visit, an ‘epic’ shift in Japan’s defense posture
item.dc:creator: Takeo Akiba
item.description: On eve of a state visit by the Japanese prime minister, a top Tokyo official sees big changes in Japan’s defense posture.

item.title: How No Labels was thwarted — and a disaster for democracy was avoided
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Rubin
item.description: Without a No Labels ticket, Biden and democracy stand a better chance of prevailing in November. That is no small thing.

item.title: Recriminalizing drugs, Oregon offers a cautionary tale
item.dc:creator: Editorial Board
item.description: The lesson from Oregon is that compassion is important for addicts, but so are consequences.

item.description: The lesson from Oregon is that compassion is important for addicts, but so are consequences.

item.title: Joe Biden must go left and right at the same time
item.dc:creator: E.J. Dionne
item.description: The president’s path to reelection will be a perilous tightrope.
